intro: Cleistanthus suarezensis, commonly known as the Suarez's cleistanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
